recipe_name: Fried christophine with corn on the cob
author: Levi Roots
method: Parboil the christophine slices in boiling water for 3-4 minutes, then drain. Melt half of the butter in a frying pan and fry the christophine and the whole scotch bonnet chillies for 4-5 minutes, turning the slices once, until the christophine is tender and golden-brown on both sides.  Microwave the corn for 4-5 minutes on high, then remove and fry in another frying pan with the remaining butter for 3-4 minutes, or until the corn is tender. To serve, pile the fried christophine and chillies onto a serving plate, and place the corn on the cob on the side.
ingredients: 1 christophine (also called chow chow), peeled, cored and sliced,  55g/2oz butter,  1 red scotch bonnet chilli, de-seeded (or to taste),  1 orange scotch bonnet chilli, de-seeded (or to taste),  1 corn on the cob
